intro: Phthirusa pycnophylla, commonly known as the dense-leaved phthirusa, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with distinctive cyathium inflorescences. The plant is characterized by its dense, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or green. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
